summary: A lighthearted and engaging interview with band members discussing fan questions, personal anecdotes, and sharing humorous stories and insights.

events_list.video_caption: The video features four men sitting on stools in a studio with a cityscape view through large windows. They are casually dressed, with visible tattoos, and appear to be engaged in a conversation. The man on the far left wears a white t-shirt with a graphic design and black pants, while the second man from the left sports a black hoodie and a cap. The third man is in a sleeveless black shirt with a logo and a cap, and the man on the far right wears a red bandana, a black vest, and a sleeveless shirt. The studio has a colorful striped carpet, and a screen in the background displays the text "purevolume" with a logo. The men are animated, with one gesturing with his hands and another holding a piece of paper. The atmosphere is relaxed and conversational, with the men interacting with each other and the camera. The video concludes with a black screen displaying the "purevolume" logo and the text "purevolume.com" in white, indicating the website associated with the studio.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker introducing himself as "Pierce the Veil" and mentioning they are at the "Pure Volume headquarters in Hollywood, California." He says they are there to answer fan questions. The clip then transitions to a sound effect: a whooshing noise immediately followed by a cartoonish-sounding impact or explosion. Finally, one of the speakers says "You ready?" and another agrees.

events_list.video_caption: The video opens with a group of four men seated on stools in a studio setting, engaged in a conversation. The studio features a large window with a cityscape view, a colorful striped carpet, and a screen displaying the text 'purevolume' (a logo for a music streaming service). The men are dressed in casual attire, with visible tattoos and accessories, suggesting a relaxed and informal atmosphere. The scene transitions to a stage setup, where two individuals are seen adjusting equipment and a backdrop with a cloud design, indicating preparations for a performance or event. The video then returns to the studio, where the men continue their discussion, with one holding a piece of paper, possibly referencing notes or a script. The atmosphere remains casual and conversational. The scene shifts to a dimly lit environment, where a man is seen holding a microphone, suggesting a live performance or recording session. The video concludes with the group back in the studio, continuing their discussion, maintaining the same relaxed and informal atmosphere throughout.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with two speakers, one a male asking a question about wishing one had written a particular song, then asking what song that would be. The first male speaker answers with “It’s raining men," speaking in a straightforward tone. The other male agrees, stating "such a good song" then indicating it is next level and he will play it at his wedding. A brief moment of silence, then the second male speaker volunteers, "I think I'm going to go with" followed by "Whitney Houston, I want to dance with somebody." The first male responds it’s a great song, then notes that any party with that song will succeed and that the song makes everyone dance. The second male speaker agrees, with an additional comment of "girls just want to have fun does pretty good too" and the first speaker saying "okay" and agreeing. The second male speaker would then choose "MJ Thriller," and the speaker comments of the greatness of that choice. The clip concludes with conversational, amicable speech.

events_list.video_caption: The video opens with a group of four men seated on stools in a studio, engaged in a conversation. The studio features a colorful striped carpet and a large window showcasing a cityscape. The men are dressed in casual attire, with one wearing a white t-shirt with a tiger graphic and the text "KEY STREET," another in a black tank top with "KEY STREET" and a logo, and the third in a black vest with tattoos visible on his arms. The fourth man wears a red bandana and a black vest. The scene transitions to a live concert setting, where a man with tattoos on his arms and neck is seen giving a thumbs-up gesture, wearing a black shirt and an earpiece. The stage is illuminated with bright lights, and the audience is visible in the background. The video then returns to the studio, where the men continue their discussion, with one holding a piece of paper. The atmosphere is casual and conversational, with the men appearing relaxed and engaged in their discussion. The video concludes with a close-up of two men, one wearing the white t-shirt with the tiger graphic and the other in a black hoodie with a green cap, both smiling and looking towards the camera. The studio setting remains consistent throughout, with the cityscape visible through the window and the "purevolume" logo displayed on a screen in the background.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with a male speaker asking about a potential collaboration with Kellen Quinn, to which another male responds that "you never know," that "anything could happen." The first male then adds the phrase "if it's not broken, don't fix it," followed by another response that "it works before, why not do it again?". The speaker then proposes doing some more questions. There is background music. The music is upbeat, and contains pop or rock elements, possibly drums. The clip ends with the sound of the first male speaker asking another question, "coming from a Mexican culture, ah yes."

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with two individuals seated side by side in a studio setting, with a cityscape visible through a large window behind them. The person on the left is wearing a white t-shirt with a tiger graphic and the text "KEY STREET" across the chest, along with a visible tattoo on their left arm. The person on the right is dressed in a black hoodie over a striped t-shirt and a green cap worn backwards, holding a stack of papers. The scene transitions to a live concert, where a guitarist is performing on stage, surrounded by an enthusiastic crowd with raised hands. The stage is bathed in purple lighting, creating a vibrant atmosphere. The video then returns to the studio setting, where the two individuals continue their conversation, with the person on the right still holding the papers. The video concludes with a close-up of the person on the left, who is now wearing a black t-shirt with a graphic design, standing on stage with a microphone in hand, suggesting a performance or speech. Throughout the video, the "purevolume" logo is visible in the bottom right corner of the frames.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with one male speaker asking how his parents reacted to his decisions to be in a band, get tattoos, and get piercings, noting that his parents never understood his music taste or approved of tattoos and piercings. Another male speaker responds, presumably beginning his answer. The background ambiance consists of music playing.

events_list.video_caption: The video features four men sitting on stools in a studio with a cityscape visible through large windows. They are engaged in a conversation, with one man holding a card and gesturing as he speaks. The men are dressed in casual, edgy clothing, including graphic t-shirts, caps, and vests, with visible tattoos on their arms. The studio has a colorful striped carpet and a screen displaying the logo "purevolume" in the background. The focus then shifts to two of the men, who are standing and continuing their conversation. One wears a black sleeveless shirt with the text "KEY STREET" and a cap, while the other sports a red and black patterned cap and a denim vest with patches. The background shows a busy street with cars and buildings, indicating an urban setting. The atmosphere is casual and conversational, with the men appearing relaxed and engaged in their discussion.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker mentioning that his "parents are really supportive of the music" he's involved in. He then shares a story about his mother's reaction to his tattoos, noting her initial disappointment followed by indifference. The speaker then trails off, and the clip ends.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a group of four men sitting on stools in a studio with a cityscape view through large windows. They are engaged in a conversation, with one man wearing a white t-shirt with a graphic design, another in a black tank top with a logo, a third in a black hoodie with a green stripe, and the fourth in a black vest with patches and a red cap. The studio has a colorful striped carpet and a screen displaying the text "purevolume" in the background. The men are animated, gesturing with their hands and occasionally looking at each other. The scene transitions to a live performance where a drummer is energetically playing a drum set under bright stage lights, with the audience visible in the background. The video then returns to the studio setting, where the men continue their discussion, with close-ups highlighting their tattoos and clothing details. The atmosphere is casual and conversational, with the men appearing relaxed and engaged in their discussion.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip features two male speakers discussing tattoos and their mothers' reactions. The first speaker describes his mother's strong initial disapproval of his first tattoo. Then, the second speaker points out their shared brotherhood and mentions his mother has several tattoos herself. The first speaker clarifies that her tattoos are in more hidden locations compared to his visible one. He adds that his mother became supportive once she saw the band he was in gaining traction and attention. Throughout the conversation, a light rock musical backdrop can be heard.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a group of four men sitting on stools in a studio with a cityscape view through large windows. They are engaged in a conversation, with one man wearing a white t-shirt with a tiger graphic and the text "KEY STREET" prominently displayed. Another man sports a black tank top with the same "KEY STREET" logo, while the third man wears a denim vest with patches and a red cap. The fourth man is dressed in a black hoodie and a green cap. The studio has a colorful striped carpet, and a screen in the background displays the text "purevolume." The men are animated, gesturing with their hands and occasionally looking at each other, indicating an engaging discussion. The video transitions to a concert scene where a performer, wearing a black tank top with "KEY STREET" on the back, is on stage with confetti falling around him, creating a lively atmosphere. The video then returns to the studio setting, where the men continue their conversation, maintaining the same dynamic and engaging demeanor.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip features a single male speaker recounting a story about his mother's changing attitude towards his tattoos. He describes how she initially "flipped" out and was very upset, even nearly hitting him, due to her dislike of tattoos. He then says he began to hide them from her. Later, he reveals how she had an abrupt change of heart when she got a tattoo herself, making him exclaim, "You freaking hypocrite, as he spoke with amusement and incredulity. During the speech, there's light background music, and at times the music fades, becoming more prominent in between phrases. The music is ambient.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a group of four men sitting on stools in a studio with a cityscape view in the background. They are engaged in a conversation, with one man holding a card and another wearing a white t-shirt with a tiger graphic and the text "KEY STREET." The men are dressed in casual attire, including hoodies, tank tops, and a denim vest with patches. The studio has a colorful striped carpet and a screen displaying the text "purevolume" in the background. The scene transitions to a live concert setting, where a man with tattoos is playing an electric guitar on stage, illuminated by blue and red lights, with a crowd visible in the background. The video then returns to the studio, where the men continue their discussion. A close-up of a man playing drums on stage is shown, followed by a return to the studio where the men are still conversing. The video concludes with a close-up of the man in the white t-shirt, who appears to be speaking, and another close-up of the man in the denim vest, who is also speaking. The overall atmosphere is casual and conversational, with the studio setting providing a relaxed backdrop for the discussion.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker reading a question from an unknown source. The speaker asks when another album will be released. A second male speaker responds humorously. The first speaker then reads another question about the band's favorite song from a record and why. He answers his favorite is a song because it is fun to play and the fans are emotional while singing along. The second speaker interrupts agreeing to liking a song because it is played acoustically rather than in the record. The first speaker continues agreeing, referencing the difference between the full band and the acoustic version. A third male speaker suggests another song, referring to the meaning behind it. The second speaker says it is about like overcoming cancer and something else. Finally, the first speaker says he will read a new question.

events_list.video_caption: The video opens with a vibrant concert scene where a musician, dressed in a green vest and black pants, energetically plays a yellow guitar, captivating a large, enthusiastic crowd. The atmosphere is electric, with the audience raising their hands and holding up their phones to capture the moment. The scene then transitions to a studio setting where four individuals, all with visible tattoos, are seated on stools, engaged in a lively discussion. They are dressed in casual attire, including t-shirts, hoodies, and caps, with one wearing a red bandana. The studio features a colorful striped carpet and a large window showcasing a cityscape. The conversation appears animated, with the participants gesturing and interacting with each other. The video then cuts back to the concert, highlighting the crowd's excitement and the musician's dynamic performance. The scene shifts back to the studio, focusing on two individuals, one in a white t-shirt with a tiger graphic and the other in a green cap and striped hoodie, who continue their discussion. The video concludes with a close-up of the individual in the red bandana, emphasizing his tattoos and the details of his denim vest adorned with patches, as he speaks animatedly. Throughout the video, the 'purevolume' logo is visible, indicating the platform or event being showcased.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with light, upbeat background music, and two male speakers engage in conversation. One speaker mentions, "Hannah Smith wants to know what high school was like for us," and the other responds about a person who was "next level." They proceed to talk about someone being a "sponsored yo-yo player," followed by laughter and then comments about dressing in "liberty spikes and plaid pants," suggesting a unique personal style. The music fades as the conversation progresses, and then there is a distinct sound effect described as "crazy sounds," which ends the clip.

events_list.video_caption: The video opens with a band performing on stage, featuring a guitarist in a black vest and a drummer in a black shirt, set against a backdrop of a large crowd and a cityscape. The scene transitions to a studio where four men, each with distinct tattoos and casual attire, are seated on stools, engaged in conversation. The studio's large windows reveal a city view, and a screen displaying 'purevolume' is visible. The men, including one in a white t-shirt with a tiger graphic and another in a black tank top with 'KEY STREET' text, are animated, gesturing as they speak. The video alternates between the studio and live performance shots, capturing the band's energetic stage presence and the audience's enthusiastic response. The men in the studio continue their discussion, with close-ups highlighting their expressions and tattoos. The video concludes with the band performing on stage, showcasing their dynamic interaction with the crowd, and the men in the studio wrapping up their conversation.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio starts with a male speaker describing himself as "shy and quiet." Then a male speaker jokes about someone eating faces. There's more talk about someone's name. One male speaker then asks what someone's worst birthday gift was. After some silence and a nervous laugh, he recalls birthdays spent driving through the Midwest, with a sarcastic "Happy Birthday!" comment. There's talk about a shot called the "Three Wise Men," made with Jim, Jack, and Jose mixed. Then one person recounts receiving a Ricky Martin knockoff shirt from his Mexican grandma, who thought it was a great gift because he lives a "crazy life." He said everyone laughed.

events_list.video_caption: The video features four men sitting on stools in a studio with a cityscape visible through large windows in the background. They are engaged in a conversation, with one man holding a piece of paper and another gesturing with his hands. The men are dressed casually, with visible tattoos and wearing caps and hoodies. The studio has a colorful striped carpet and a screen displaying the text 'purevolume' in the background. The atmosphere is relaxed and conversational, with the men appearing to be in a discussion or interview setting. The video concludes with a black screen displaying the 'purevolume' logo.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip starts with a male speaker reminiscing about a past Christmas, recalling how he accidentally cut the cords of his brother's toy drumsticks, ruining the gift. His tone is casual and narrative. Suddenly, this is interrupted by an intense, high-pitched electronic sound resembling a screech.
